titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Houston Area Asian Archives oral history interviews and related materials, 2003-2021 MS 573
titlestmt.author: Amanda Focke and Sarah Callahan

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-07-08 12:46:25 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Houston Asian American Archives oral history interviews and related materials

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Rice University Chao Center for Asian Studies

did.abstract: This is a collection of oral history interviews conducted by the Chao Center for Asian Studies, featuring audio recordings and transcripts of interviews with Asian Americans native to Houston.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Chao Center for Asian Studies is a research institute attached to an undergraduate major at Rice University. The Center supports a model of Asian Studies that looks carefully and critically at the complex ways people in 'Asia' have been involved with one another and with the rest of the world, not only today, but also in the past. Toward these ends, they work closely with peer organizations in inter-Asia, indeed, in some cases with those whom they study, and in every case collaborating with scholars who pursue similar questions as they do.

The Chao Center for Asian Studies builds on the core initiatives outlined in Rice University President David Leebron's "Vision for the Second Century." These are: (1) visibly and substantially increasing our commitment to our research mission and raising our research and scholarship profile; (2) aggressively fostering collaborative relationships with other institutions to leverage our resources; (3) becoming an international university, with a more significant orientation toward Asia and Latin America than now characterizes our commitments.
(This information was excerpted from the Chao Center for Asian Studies website http://chaocenter.rice.edu/about-the-center.aspx on December 1, 2010.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a collection of oral history interviews conducted by the Chao Center for Asian Studies at Rice University. This collection includes audio recordings and transcripts of interviews with the following Asian Americans native to Houston: Edward Chen, Esther Quan, Gene L. Lee, Lewis Yee, Jane Gee, George Gee, Viola Chan, Wea Lee, Eugenie Chen, and Hannah Chow. The interviewees include a former rocket scientist and high school chemistry teacher, a founding member of the Chinese American Citizens Alliance, a World War II veteran, and the publisher of a Chinese newspaper in Texas and owner of the first Chinese printing company in Houston.
There are currently 147 English language audio interviews in the collection, mostly dating from 2010-2015, with expectation that more new interviews will be added annually.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from this material must be obtained through the Woodson Research center, Fondren Library, Rice University, woodson@rice.edu.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred from the Chao Center for Asian Studies beginning in 2010, through the present.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Houston Asian American Archives oral history interviews, MS 573, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Edward C.M. Chen Family Collection, 1920-2010, MS 561. Finding aid: http://library.rice.edu/collections/WRC/finding-aids/manuscripts/0561
Gene & Hedy Lee Chinese language newspapers & photographs, 1962-2010, MS 556. Finding aid: http://library.rice.edu/collections/WRC/finding-aids/manuscripts/0556/

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Additions to this collection may be expected over time.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Philippine Nurses Association of Metropolitan Houston : 30th anniversary & induction of 2010-12 Executive Board. Houston, Tex. : The Association, 2010.

442 [videorecording] : live with honor, die with dignity / 442 Film Partners present a UTB Pictures and Film Voice production ; written and directed by Junichi Suzuki. Hollywood, CA : United Television Broadcasting Systems, 2010. "Testimonies of former veterans including Senator Daniel K. Inouye and interviews with actor George Takei and prominent community leaders tell the largely unknown stories of unprecedented military bravery and valot of the veterans." Fondren Library call # D769.31 442nd .A14 2010
The Gees in Houston, Texas. Published by Gee Family Association, 1998.

did.unittitle: Outstanding Preceptor Award (2013): Plaque from the Houston Academy of Nutrition & Dietetics presented to Dr. Beverly Gor
Certificate of Appreciation: Presented from the USDA Center for Nutrition Policy and Promotion, recognizing Dr. Beverly Gor's work with CAN DO Houston
Certificate of Appreciation (04/29/13): Presented during Health Awareness Month recognizing Dr. Beverly Gor's "invaluable community service promoting health equity and reducing health disparities"
Outstanding Preceptor Award Veteran (2013): Award presented from the Texas Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics to Dr. Beverly Gor
TDA Media Award (2007): Plaque presented from the Houston Area Dietetic Association

Nursing Excellence: Problem Solving, Populations, and Performance (July 27, 2014): Plaque recognizing Dr. Beverly Gor for Presenting "Health and Cancer needs of Asian Pacific Islanders: Stories from the 'Model Minority"
Appreciation Plaque (March, 2004): Plaque from the Houston Department of Health and Human Services "in appreciation of [Dr. Gor's] time and support of [the] WIC Nutrition Education Program"
Origami Frame (June, 2007): Presented from the Asian American Health Coalition/HOPE Clinic "in appreciation for [Dr. Gor's] selfless dedication and servant leadership in establishing HOPE Clinic"
National Forensic League Certification (11/18/70): Award certifying that Dr. Gor was elected as a member of the National Forensic Leage at Houston-Milby
Certificate of Appreciation (07/27/02): Presented from the Stand Against Violence Everyone Alief organization for Dr. Gor's contributions to the Alief Health and Civic Resources Fair.
Certificate of Appreciation (07/19/00): Presented to Dr. Gor from the Texas Health Steps Outreach Workgroup for her guest presentation "Reaching Out to the Outreach Worker"
Recognition Award (2004): Presented from the Texas Cancer Council in recognition for Dr. Gor's service to the Texas Cancer Plan Update Project
Seminar Speaker Plaque (July 4, 2009): Presented from the Federation of Bangladeshi Associations in North America to Dr. Gor for her work as the Seminar Speaker at the FOBANA 2009 Convention
University of Texas Graduation Appreciation Award (2004): Presented from Rachel Gor to her parents for "...helping [her] to attain this most important milestone of [her] life"
Distinguished Dietitian Award (2004): Presented by Jill Campbell of the Houston Area Dietetic Association to Dr. Beverly Gor
Wooden Frame with Script: (Text in Chinese)

dao.xlink:title: Beverly Gor family photos

daodesc.p: Beverly Gor family photos: 2016-

odd.head: General
odd.p: Contains photos from Beverly Gor's mother and father's photo albums: "Lung Kong Lodge, San Francisco" and "To Mr & Mrs. Gordon Quan, From Uncle Paul & Aunt Mae, 1981."

dao.xlink:title: Kenneth Takehara oral history interview and transcript

daodesc.p: Kenneth Takehara oral history interview and transcript: 2011-

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes consent form and transcript for 2011 interview. Also donated at the time of that interview were other interview recordings and materials as listed here: Takehara family scrapbook (print from PDF copy); State of Texas certificate commissioning 442nd Regimental Combat Team, World War II, as Honorary Texas Citizens, signed by Texas Gov. John Connally, Oct. 21, 1963; Program for Congressional Gold Medal Ceremony, Houston, TX, Feb. 19, 2012; program for National Japanese American Memorial Foundation Awards Dinner Gala 2009; "Go for Broke" Takehara interview on DVD, undated, untranscribed; WWII 42nd interview on DVD, 2003, untranscribed. Rights to share these interviews publicly online were not expressly included with the donation.

did.unittitle: Series III: Subject files and photographs unrelated to specific interviews
Forbidden City images, 28 black and white images
Hope Clinic brochure (HOPE - Helping Other People Through Encouragement) a community health center funded by the Asian American Health Coalition of Greater Houston. Ca. 2011.
OCA Greater Houston magazine "4a", Fall 2011 issue (OCA - Organization of Chinese Americans)
Community Forum: Immigration and Citizenship Workshop Flyer, 2012
Photograph: Gerald Young, of the Flying Tigers, World War II
Photograph: Elder members of the Chinese Jamaican community, ca. 1940
Photograph: Street scene of World War II victory parade of Chinese Jamaicans honoring Chiang, in Kingston, Jamaica
Liu, Chieh-min: United States Army Air Corps Training Center diploma certifying Liu Chieh-min as a trained airplane pilot, 1943
Liu, Chieh-min: Authorization from Chiang Kai-shek (Jiang Zhongzheng) to Accept Training in the USA (written in Chinese)
Liu, Chieh-min: Arizona Drivers License, 1943 (image of)
Japanese American Citizens League website pages as captured by George Hirasaki, November 2010 (on cd-rom and printed on paper)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes chapter history (folder 11), miscellaneous activism (folder 12), services provided by JACL (folder 13), miscellaneous administrative records (folder 14), miscellaneous events (folder 15), Abbie Salyers Grub's paper (folder 16), 65th anniversary presentation (folder 17), Texas state board of education (folder 18), tpm (folder 19), responses (folder 20), pictures (folder 21), Japan fest 2008 (folder 22), and Gala 2009 (folder 23).

did.unittitle: Panis, Francisco: WWII United States Army Forces in the Far East
Video interview, ca. 2005 (no transcript) (disc in box, not yet online per consent form needs - request further identifying info from donor)
Program from posthumous military medal ceremony and screening of film "Forgotten Soliders," 2012
C. Y. Chu documents and realia, 1920-1936
John (Chong) Henry Eng documents regarding WWII service
Albert Gee clippings and ephemera related to his restaurant businesses, including the Poly-Asian Club.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also includes commemorative plate inscribed "Tuesday, October 16, 1962, Epicurean Evening, Your Host, Houston Restaurant Association" and is believed to be the plate presented to Albert Gee, who in 1961 was the first the first Asian-American president of the Houston Restaurant Association (HRA). Donated by Dr. Anne Chao, to whom the plate was presented in 2021 by the HRA.

did.unittitle: Rudolfo Hulen Fernandex, first known Asian graduate from Rice, 1917 - newsclippings
Photograph of interior of Chungking Restaurant, Jensen Dr and Caplin St., Houston, TX, circa 1940s

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chungking Restaurant was owned by Jim Wing, who was one of the first Chinese in Houston, arriving circa 1895. The Jim Wing family was part of the Joe family, and Jim Wing helped many Joe family members move to Houston and Texas. Wing owned many restaurants in downtown Houston, 1930s-1940s.

did.unittitle: Time magazine featuring on cover: "Madame Chiang: She and China know what endurance means" March 1, 1943
Life magazine, featuring on cover "China's Madame Chiang," June 30, 1941
Outstanding Preceptor Award (2013): Plaque from the Houston Academy of Nutrition & Dietetics presented to Dr. Beverly Gor
Certificate of Appreciation (?): Presented from the USDA Center for Nutrition Policy and Promotion, recognizing Dr. Beverly Gor's work with CAN DO Houston
Certificate of Appreciation (04/29/13): Presented during Health Awareness Month recognizing Dr. Beverly Gor's "invaluable community service promoting health equity and reducing health disparities"
Outstanding Preceptor Award Veteran (2013): Award presented from the Texas Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics to Dr. Beverly Gor
TDA Media Award (2007): Plaque presented from the Houston Area Dietetic Association

Nursing Excellence: Problem Solving, Populations, and Performance (July 27, 2014): Plaque recognizing Dr. Beverly Gor for Presenting "Health and Cancer needs of Asian Pacific Islanders: Stories from the 'Model Minority'"
Wooden Frame with Script (?): Text in Chinese
Appreciation Plaque (March, 2004): Plaque from the Houston Department of Health and Human Services "in appreciation of [Dr. Gor's] time and support of [the] WIC Nutrition Education Program"
Origami Frame (June, 2007): Presented from the Asian American Health Coalition/HOPE Clinic "in appreciation for [Dr. Gor's] selfless dedication and servant leadership in establishing HOPE Clinic"
Framed Newspaper Article (01/25/02): Text in Chinese
National Forensic League Certification (11/18/70): Award certifying that Dr. Gor was elected as a member of the National Forensic Leage at Houston-Milby
Certificate of Appreciation (07/27/02): Presented from the Stand Against Violence Everyone Alief organization for Dr. Gor's contributions to the Alief Health and Civic Resources Fair.
Certificate of Appreciation (07/19/00): Presented to Dr. Gor from the Texas Health Steps Outreach Workgroup for her guest presentation "Reaching Out to the Outreach Worker"
Seminar Speaker Plaque (July 4, 2009): Presented from the Federation of Bangladeshi Associations in North America to Dr. Gor for her work as the Seminar Speaker at the FOBANA 2009 Convention
University of Texas Graduation Appreciation Award (2004): Presented from Rachel Gor to her parents for "...helping [her] to attain this most important milestone of [her] life"
Distinguished Dietitian Award (2004): Presented by Jill Campbell of the Houston Area Dietetic Association to Dr. Beverly Gor
Recognition Award (2004): Presented from the Texas Cancer Council in recognition for Dr. Gor's service to the Texas Cancer Plan Update Project
Artwork by Sherry Tseng Hill, "Forgive but not forget," acrylic painting on canvas board

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dimensions 48" (W) x 18" (H) x 3" (T). Original work stored in Woodson vault. Folder contains a printed image of the painted work.

did.unittitle: Hella Bubble boba tea cup and newsclip for best Boba / teahouse in Houston, June 2020, donated by owner Titan Huang
